sentences.en: After the severest reprimand, he did not tremble.
sentences.cn: 即使受到最严厉的申斥, 他也不发抖.

sentences.en: Before she could reply, my mother launched into a severe reprimand.
sentences.cn: 她还没来得及回答，我妈妈就开始严厉地训斥起她来。

sentences.en: He has been fined five thousand dollars and given a severe reprimand.
sentences.cn: 他被罚款5000美元，并且受到严厉的训斥。

sentences.en: He has been fined five thousand pounds and given a severe reprimand.
sentences.cn: 他被罚款5,000英镑，并受到了严厉斥责。

sentences.en: He may gently reprimand an official or even suggest to parliament that a law be altered.
sentences.cn: 他可以温和地批评某一官员,也可以向议会建议修改某条法律.

sentences.en: He may gently reprimand an official or even suggest to parliament that a law the altered.
sentences.cn: 他可以善意地批评某位官员,也可以甚至向议会提议修改某项法律.

sentences.en: He was reprimanded by a teacher for talking in the corridor.
sentences.cn: 他因在走廊里说话而被一位老师训斥。

sentences.en: Her attempts to reprimand him were quickly shouted down.
sentences.cn: 她本想斥责他，但很快就被大声喝止了。

sentences.en: His boss gave him a reprimand for being late.
sentences.cn: 他的老板因他迟到而训了他一顿.
他玩忽职守并未受到斥责.

sentences.en: I let him off the hook with a mild reprimand.
sentences.cn: 我只是轻微的斥责使他脱离了困境.

sentences.en: I was obliged to reprimand him for the sake of discipline.
sentences.cn: 为了维持纪律,我不得不说了几句.

sentences.en: In other days she would have been forced at least to reprimand him severely.
sentences.cn: 如果是在以前,她至少不能不对他严厉地训诉一番.

sentences.en: No current provision for a public reprimand.
sentences.cn: 无现行的公开惩戒条款.

sentences.en: She was reprimand for putting undur pressure on her clients.
sentences.cn: 她因给顾客施加过度的压力而受责备.

sentences.en: The principal reprimand the student for his chronic lateness.
sentences.cn: 校长斥责那个学生不该接二连三地迟到.

sentences.en: These verbs mean to reprimand or criticize angrily or vehemently.
sentences.cn: 这些动词意为愤怒或恶毒地斥责或批评.

trans.tran_en: to tell someone officially that something they have done is very wrong
